tests.test:
mv: file (absolute path) to file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz /file1 -fs NAMENODE -mv /file1 /file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls /file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm /file2 :
TokenComparator Found 1 items
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file[^1]

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to file (relative path)

comparator.expected-output: ^mv: Failed to rename hdfs://\w+[.a-z]*:[0-9]*/file1 to file2

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); keep the same name at the destination
mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); keep the same name at the destination [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: Cannot access /file1: No such file or directory.

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); change the name at the destination
mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); change the name at the destination [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: Cannot access /file1: No such file or directory.

test.description: mv: files (absolute path) to directory (absolute path) using globbing
mv: files (absolute path) to directory (absolute path) using globbing [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: Cannot access /file*: No such file or directory.

test.description: mv: file (relative) to file (relative)

tests.test:
cp: file (absolute path) to file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz /file1 -fs NAMENODE -cp /file1 /file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls /file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm /file* :
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file1
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2

test.description: cp: file (absolute path) to file (relative path)
cp: file (relative path) to file (absolute path)
cp: file (relative path) to file (relative path)
cp: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); keep the same name at the destination
cp: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); change the name at the destination
cp: files to directory (absolute path) using globbing
cp: files to directory (absolute path) without globbing

tests.test:
cp: copying non existent file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -cp /file /file1
-fs NAMENODE -rmr /user :
RegexpComparator ^cp: File does not exist: /file

cp: copying non existent file (relative path)
-fs NAMENODE -cp file1 file2
-fs NAMENODE -rmr /user :
RegexpComparator ^cp: File does not exist: file1

test.description: cp: files to an existent file using globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination should be a directory.

test.description: cp: files to an existent file without globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination /file5 should be a directory.

test.description: cp: files to a non existent directory using globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination should be a directory.

test.description: cp: files to a non existent directory without globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination dir should be a directory.
